description:
Easy to use and understand. Has done a great job over the years.

It would be cool if there was a way a new feature added to do a mock install to set up the a configuration file. This file would be written to the install disk in folder called something like: "Headless Configuration", "No Questions Asked", something like that.

If a file is present when the installer starts up it will install based on that criteria without asking for questions.

This could be helpful if a person is need to set up several identical computers with Ubuntu.

This also would help if a person needs to do a headless install, for example I only have a DisplayLink usb monitor which needs drivers installed to use. So it's not possible to use for an installation.

On that train of though, an apt folder would be great as well, so that .deb packages could be just dropped in it.

And a folder for post install scripts for example for a drivers install scripts.

I don't know if this is feasible, but in theory it would be really cool to see this app could do this stuff.
summary: Great app, would recommend a no questions asked feature
Won't Install. Unanle to download odts.gnome.org
